page.title: 15OLD HALL
page.content: Old Hall was built in 1550. It has 12 main rooms ( 5 bedrooms, 3 attic rooms and 4 main rooms downstairs) and a cellar. Mrs.Hugh lives there and she also teaches some children in our school to play the violin. At the moment Mrs Hugh's house is being repaired. Mr Smith is taking the front of the house down and is using poles to support the walls. Along the front of the house is carved "Walke, knave, what lookest at?" This was put there in 1647 and it is believed that the owner did so because everyone kept staring at this lovely black and white building as they walked past. Another possible ex- planation is that King Charles may have hidden there and did not want to be given away by someone staring. The house was built to a plan like a cross and was originally a farmhouse.
